name: Pregabalin (Lyrica)
summary: Pregabalin is an anticonvulsant and neuropathic pain agent used to treat epilepsy, fibromyalgia, generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), and nerve pain associated with conditions like diabetes or shingles.
description: Pregabalin, marketed under the brand name Lyrica, is a structural analog of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) but does not act directly on GABA receptors. Instead, it binds to the alpha-2-delta subunit of voltage-gated calcium channels in the central nervous system, reducing calcium influx at nerve terminals and thereby decreasing the release of excitatory neurotransmitters. It is prescribed for partial-onset seizures, neuropathic pain, fibromyalgia, and GAD in some regions. Pregabalin is taken orally and is known for its predictable absorption and rapid onset of action.

off_label_uses: Central neuropathic pain in multiple sclerosis
monitoring_required: Renal function (dose adjustment may be needed)

sections.text: Pregabalin binds to the alpha-2-delta subunit of voltage-gated calcium channels in CNS tissue, reducing calcium influx and decreasing the release of neurotransmitters like glutamate, norepinephrine, and substance P.

adult.Neuropathic pain: Start at 150 mg/day in divided doses; may increase to 300–600 mg/day as tolerated
adult.Fibromyalgia: Start at 150 mg/day; may increase to 300–450 mg/day
adult.Seizures: Start at 150 mg/day; titrate to 600 mg/day

sections.geriatric: Adjust dose based on renal function
sections.renal_impairment: Dose adjustment required according to creatinine clearance

items: Capsules: 25 mg, 50 mg, 75 mg, 100 mg, 150 mg, 200 mg, 225 mg, 300 mg

sections.text: Onset: Within 1 week for neuropathic pain; Duration: 12–24 hours depending on dose

other: May cause CNS depression; caution with other sedatives
Abrupt discontinuation may cause withdrawal symptoms—taper gradually

sections.pregnancy: Category C; use only if benefits outweigh potential risk
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; avoid or monitor infant
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity to adverse CNS effects

sections.text: Reduce gradually over at least 1 week to minimize withdrawal symptoms

items: Predictable pharmacokinetics with minimal drug-drug interactions
Often used when gabapentin is ineffective or poorly tolerated
May improve sleep quality in patients with chronic pain
